data.title: www.worldonlinecinema.com
data.meta_description: Posts about Henri-Georges Clouzot written by julianwhiting
data.text:
MANON (TBA) 1949 FRANCE CLOUZOT, HENRI-GEORGES BLU RAY ONLY £23.99

Loose adaptation of Abbé Prévost’s novel Manon Lescaut, which has been transposed to a World War II setting.

Village girl, Manon, is accused of collaborating with the Nazis and is rescued from imminent execution by a former French Resistance fighter.

The couple move to Paris, where they resort to profiteering, prostitution and murder to survive.

In French with English subtitles

SPECIAL EDITION CONTENTS

• High Definition Blu-ray (1080p) presentation

• Original 1.0 mono audio

• Optional English subtitles

• Bibliothèque de poche: H.G. Clouzot, an archival documentary from 1970 in which Clouzot talks of his love of literature and the relationship between the page and the screen

• Woman in the Dunes, a newly filmed video appreciation by film critic Geoff Andrew

• Image gallery

• Reversible sleeve featuring two artwork options

DVD available to buy at –

http://www.worldonlinecinema.com/Home/french-dvds

LE CORBEAU (PG) 1943 FRANCE HENRI-GEORGES CLOUZOT £17.99

First French film noir made in German occupied France which ensured a storm of controversy and it was attacked by the right-wing Vichy regime, the left-wing Resistance press and the Catholic Church.

The film is set in the small provincial St Robin, where a series of poison-pen letters signed ‘Le Corbeau’ appear to denounce several prominent members of the town. The dark side of St Robin is revealed, with the townspeople afraid to accuse each other for fear of being accused themselves, as suspicion and hatred becomes the norm.

In French with English subtitles

FRENCH LANGUAGE TEACHING NOTES TO LE CORBEAU

ENGLISH LANGUAGE FILM NOTES TO LE CORBEAU

GERMAN LANGUAGE FILM NOTES TO LE CORBEAU

LA PRISONNIÈRE (15) 1968 FRANCE CLOUZOT, HENRI-GEORGES DVD – £19.99 BLU RAY – £22.99

Stanislas is a voyeuristic Parisian art gallery owner who becomes involved with Josée, the wife of an avant-garde artist.

The film combines Josée’s sadomasochistic fantasies with elements of pop and psychedelic art and a striking dream sequence .

In French with English subtitles

QUAI DES ORFÈVRES (PG) 1947 FRANCE CLOUZOT, HENRI-GEORGES DVD – £19.99 BLU RAY – £22.99

Married music hall singer Jenny, leaps at the chance to perform some shows for ageing, wealthy businessman Brignon. However when Brignon’s is found dead, Jenny’s husband becomes the prime suspect.

In French with English subtitles

DVD available to buy at –

http://www.worldonlinecinema.com/Home/french-dvds

Other movies by Henri-Georges Clouzot available on dvd

L’ASSASSIN HABITE AU 21/MURDERER LIVES AT 21 (12) 1942 FRANCE CLOUZOT, HENRI-GEORGES DVD – £17.99 BLU RAY – £19.99

A thief and killer stalks the streets of Paris, leaving a calling card from ‘Monsieur Durand’ at the scene of each crime.

LES DIABOLIQUES (18) 1954 B/W FRANCE CLOUZOT, HENRI-GEORGES DVD – £12.99 BLU RAY – £19.99

A man’s mistress and his wife join forces in this classic Noir thriller.

HENRI GEORGE CLOUZOT’S INFERNO (E) 2009 FRANCE BROMBERG,S/MEDREA, R BLU RAY ONLY £23.99

Documentary in which film archivist Serge Bromberg tells the story of an unfinished film by French auteur Henri-Georges Clouzot: ‘L’Enfer’ starring Romy Schneider

ENGLISH LANGUAGE NOTES TO INFERNO

LE SALAIRE DE LA PEUR/THE WAGES OF FEAR (PG) 1953 FRANCE B/W CLOUZOT, HENRI-GEORGES 2 DISC DUAL FORMAT DVD/BLU RAY SET £19.99

Yves Montant stars in this compelling adventure thriller about two sets of rival truckers moving nitroglycerine through the heat of the jungle and across the dangerous mountain roads of the Andes.

DVD available to buy at –

http://www.worldonlinecinema.com/Home/french-dvds
